author: Madurai Bureau
text:
A flying squad seized Rs.3.06 lakh from a Mumbai-based builder even as he was going towards Madurai from Kollam in a car on Wednesday.

When the flying squad, led by tahsildar Gopi Krishnan was conducting a vehicle check near the Vasudevanallur MLA office on Tenkasi – Madurai Highway, the team stopped the car and recovered the “unaccounted money.”

The occupant Sasi Nair (55) of Vadakkuilai near Kollam told the interrogators that he was running a construction company in Mumbai and was going from his native place. As he could not provide any valid document to account for the cash, the money was confiscated.

Nagercoil

A flying squad seized Rs.3.40 lakh from a person travelling in an autorickshaw in Ettanni near Karungal in Kanyakumari district on Tuesday night.

According to officials, the cash was seized from Gilistus. As he could not have proper proof for handling the cash, the officials seized the amount.

A total of Rs.14.07 lakh was so far seized from four persons from Nagercoil, Killiyoor and Padmanabapuram constituencies. However, no cash was seized from Kanyakumari, Vilavancode and Colachel constituencies, a nodal officer attached to the election department here said. Of this, Rs.1,78,800, seized from a man from Nagercoil constituency, was returned after he had produced proper documents for carrying the cash.

She said that over 2,612 cases had been registered by the authorities as on date for violation of model code of conduct since March 4 – 654 cases for wall graffiti, 1457 for pasting posters, 106 for banners and 395 miscellaneous ones, the official said.
title: Cash seized in two places
